title: 108_hr5319
content: The Act titled "Renewable Energy Financing Incentive Act of 2004" allows for nonrecognition of gain from the sale of real property upon the subsequent purchase of renewable energy property under section 1046 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Act allows for nonrecognition of gain from the sale of real property if the taxpayer elects to apply the section, the sale gives rise to gain, and renewable energy property is acquired within the replacement period. Gain resulting from the acquisition of renewable energy property is recognized only to the extent that the sale price exceeds the cost of the acquired property. The gain determined under paragraph (1) shall be recognized for renewable energy property located in the United States, using renewable energy sources for electricity generation or fuel manufacture. Special rules apply to partnership interests and stock in corporations owning renewable energy property. Cooperatives are subject to similar rules as partnerships or corporations. The basis of renewable energy property is the same as the property exchanged, with rules for identification and a 2-year replacement period. Cooperatives are subject to similar rules as partnerships or corporations. The basis of renewable energy property is determined by the property exchanged, with adjustments for money received, gain, or loss. If a taxpayer disposes of renewable energy property, any unrecognized gain will be recognized. Exceptions include dispositions after the taxpayer's death or in a compulsory conversion before the threat. If a taxpayer disposes of renewable energy property, any unrecognized gain will be recognized, except in cases after the taxpayer's death, in a compulsory conversion before the threat, or if the disposition aimed to avoid federal income tax. If gain is realized on the sale or exchange of renewable energy property with an election under subsection (a), the statute of limitations for assessing deficiency shall not expire before 3 years from notifying the Secretary of the cost of purchasing renewable energy. The statute of limitations for assessing deficiency on the sale or exchange of renewable energy property with an election under subsection (a) is extended to 3 years from notifying the Secretary of the cost of purchasing renewable energy. The statute of limitations for assessing deficiency on the sale or exchange of renewable energy property with an election under subsection (a) is extended to 3 years from notifying the Secretary of the cost of purchasing renewable energy. Additionally, amendments are made to section 1046 regarding the nonrecognition of gain on property acquisitions. The amendments made by section 1046 allow for nonrecognition of gain from the sale of real property upon subsequent purchase of renewable energy property, effective for real property sold after December 31, 2004.
